dialogues.The:
[1]   				Screenplay by Don Macpherson                            					June 21, 1995        
[2]			Steed -- ?!   
[3]			Brenda and I thought we'd drop in.  	Mother suits action to the word, drops into his wheelchair.  
[4]			Weather's turning nasty.  
[5]			Oh yes I did. I want you to meet 			somebody. 				 			I expect you'll like her.  	Brenda coolly files her nails.  A flash of jealousy.  
[6]			That's better. I much prefer a 			womb with view, don't you, Mrs. 			Peel?  	A delicate CLOCK on the mantel CHIMES FOUR.  	Mother wheels himself forward and hooks onto the kettle.  
[7]			Shall I be mother?  	He pours, presiding like a fat spider at the center of a subterranean web, known as The 	Ministry: a vast bureaucracy in a labyrinth of tunnels.  	Catches Emma's wandering lock  
[8]			I expect you're wondering where 			you are.  	An atmosphere of a gentleman's club reigns in the subterranean bureau -- Emma takes 	her tea ...  
[9]			Close. We're so hush-hush, even 			we know nothing about it. 				(before Emma can 				make sense of this) 			Now let's see, there's coconut cake, 			date and walnut; I recommend the 			rum baba ...  
[10]			Looks like rain, Steed...  
[11]			Oh, yes we are.  
[12]			We've had a series of bizarre weather reports. 			We kept them hush-hush and sent agents into 			the field for data. Case number one: 			April 14, 3:35 P.M., Special Agent Simkins 			investigating mysterious fires in corn circles. 			A field outside the village of Little Snoring, 			one of the hottest days of the year. Trapped 			by a sudden blizzard. Found frozen to death 			in a giant ice cube -- like a mammoth in 			perma-frost. 				 			Case two: Pilot Raymond Shaw, May 6, 11:28 A.M. 			Took off from a deserted airstrip near Stoke Poges, 			investigating bizarre atmospheric reports. A freak 			rainstorm downed him. Knocked unconscious by a 			flying fish, falling from 15,000 feet. Twenty-five 			inches of rain in eight minutes, over an area the size 			of a cricket pitch ... 				 			... Case three: June 2, 5:43 P.M. Defense Chief 			Major Courtnay. Remains discovered in a turnip 			field near Ashby de la Zouche. Our boffins 			recorded a sudden blast of heat. Scorched earth, 			temperature of 1000 degrees. Spontaneous 			combustion. Not much of him left ...  	CLICK.  The lights go back on.  Emma notices - a new arrival 	 	a tall, striking OLDER WOMAN; dark glasses.  
[13]			My number two. Special assignments. 			She's --  
[14]			All happy families here, Mrs. Peel.  	Father's dark glasses turn to Emma like a hawk.  Runs her fingers over Emma's face. 	Gets the outline.  Emma realizes --  
[15]			God, you're quick.  
[16]			Have a look at these, Mrs. Peel --  	He passes 'round a box of evidence related to the screen events:  Steed investigates a 	pair of black shoes and bowler; Emma, a fish.  The shoes have agent Simkins' name 	in them ...  
[17]			A series of bizarre shifts in local weather 			patterns ...  
[18]			Jungle plants in the Arctic? A lush 			English village transformed overnight 			into African scrubland? Blizzards in summer?  
[19]			Something strange is happening. And 			whoever knows about it doesn't want 			us to find out.  
[20]				 			Your mission is simple. Find out 			how and why these agents died.  
[21]			Your research into climate engineering was 			state-of-the-art. Your experiments could 			have revolutionized our knowledge of global 			warming -- had they succeeded. We need 			your expertise.  
[22]			One moment, Mrs. Peel. There's another 			special reason we wanted you to join our 			happy family; rather curious, actually ...  	Mother hits the lights.  He flicks the video into slow-mo.  File thru image clarification, 	identikit sketches.  
[23]			Eye witness reports. Strangers in the area. 			One description tallied in all three places. 			Recognize her?  	Emma locks.  On the screen comes -- Emma Peel.  Steed reacts.  
[24]			Think of it as special assignment, Mrs. Peel. 			With a twist. You're our chief suspect.  
[25]			Father will be your controller. Steed here 			will show you the ropes.  
[26]			She may not know. Theory goes she 			may be very ill.  
[27]			Possibly. Split personality ...  
[28]			Who knows? If Dr. Darling is right, 			you should watch out.  
[29]			She may try to kill you.   
[30]			Something went wrong. System malfunction. 			Explosion. Mrs. Peel had a narrow escape. 			Suspected sabotage. Nothing proven. File 			still open.  
[31]			Still doesn't. Better safe than sorry.  She 			was in a dangerous game, Steed. High 			stakes. She may prove to be a risk.  If 			she is, there's only one solution.  Termination.  
[32]			You.  	OFF Steed's reaction.  CLASHING BLADES OVER ...   
[33] 	Dark.  Switches on the light.  And gasps.   
[34] 	Meanwhile Emma wakes up. Turns the corner.  Towards the other room, sees dead 	Teddy.  Reads the label on his suitcase ...  
[35]  
[36]			Emergency alert ...   
[37]			A cyclone hit Banffshire last night. 			Completely unpredicted ...   
[38]			Mobile HQ. In a blue funk.  Can't 			take chances. I'm looking after 			things while he's hiding out ...  	Father drives like a maniac.  She senses their unease.  
[39]			You're probably wondering how I 			can drive 'blind.' Simple. A new 			prototype from the boys in X division. 			Micro-sensors in the system read 			signals and road information. Converts 			the info into miles per hour. 			Ultra-sensitive.  Ultra-smart.  	Father jumps a red light.  CARS SCREECH together in a huge pile-up.  Not that smart. 	Steed holds onto his hat.  
[40]			So you say ...  
[41]			It's Mother you have to convince. 			He's very agitated.  Wait here.  	Father SCREECHES to a halt on Holland Park Avenue  	Steed and Emma get out.  Father takes off ...  
[42]			Welcome to mobile H.Q. Weather's 			turning quite nasty. Sir August was 			blown to smithereens. Along with 			half of Banffshire.  The Ministry's 			worried.  
[43]			Too late anyway. Today's escapade 			was only for starters. This is no 			ordinary weather. It's manmade. A 			kind of weather bomb.  
[44]			Would it be possible to use it for 			military purposes?  
[45]			London. The World Council of Ministers 			meets soon on global defence. If you can 			control the weather, you control the world.  
[46] 	Steed looks around, picks the lock ... hi-tech style ...   
[47] 	A kind of space-age travel agency.  Steed enters.  	At the reception desk, the receptionist has her back turned.  Steed sneaks in, moves 	behind a screen, overhears --  	A man -- Bailey -- giving orders to the receptionist  
[48] 	Emma sees a statue of a Butler.  Which springs to life.  Summons Emma.  She follows 	down a path strewn with leaves.  	As Emma steps on the leaves, she --  	Falls down -- a giant rabbit hole.   
[49]			This man -- did you see him?  
[50]				 			You are here under observation, 			Mrs. Peel. You must answer Dr. 			Darling's questions  	Pushes Dr. Darling aside.  
[51]				 			You need treatment, Mrs. Peel.  You 			can't resign.  
[52]			Don't open that, Mrs. Peel!  	Fat chance ... she goes in ...   
[53]				 			We want to help...!  
[54]			The death of Peter Peel was a 			great loss. To us all ...  
[55]			Peter Peel was a first class agent. 			A senior operative. 			'X' department Special operations. 			He was engaged in top secret research. 			Top priority.  Government approved.  
[56]			A cover ... for us. 				 			I'm sorry...  	A turning moment for Emma.  A life lived on a lie.  
[57]			... was written by me. 				 			It was sabotage, Mrs. Peel.  	Deadly serious, Emma walks over to him.  
[58]			Quite frankly ... it could have 			been you.  	Silence.  Emma looks away, shocked.  Steed intervenes  
[59]			Her husband suspected someone very 			close to the operation. On the day he 			died, he was setting a test. 			To prove to himself -- to us that his 			wife was beyond suspicion. He had to 			be certain. He said he was going to 			give Mrs. Peel something ...  	Emma keeps staring at Mother, fingers her diamond ring.  
[60]			... I want you to remember. Did 			Peter give you anything on-that 			day?   
[61]			Under suspicion. Everyone died in 			the explosion, Mrs. Peel. You were 			the only survivor ...  	Mother waits.  Emma turns round.  Looks fiercely at him.  Mother shifts uneasily as 	Emma walks past him to the airlock.  
[62]			This is an official matter, Mrs. 			Peel. No need to take it 			personally. Where are you going?  
[63]			The doors and walls are monitored, 			Mrs. Peel. This is a very secure 			establishment.  
[64]			Pity. I was growing fond of Mrs. 			Peel. Unfortunately --  
[65]			Mother and Father know best.  	Mother wheels himself off.  Then stops; over his shoulder:  
[66]			Something quick. Nothing too ... 			messy.  	ON Steed.  CAR ROAR over as --   
[67] 	Steed on the phone.  
[68] 	At the controls, Brenda looks on.  She hands a bag of jelly babies to Mother.  Who 	picks out his favorites, as he gives a briefing to Father and others, sitting in 	passenger seats --  	ORDERS BARKED OUTSIDE as --  
[69]			Inside that hall are some of the 			Most powerful figures in the 			world. Tight security. Our 			only option.  
[70]			I'll see to it personally.  	Brenda glances over at Father's imperturbable face. As --   
[71]			We want Mrs. Peel.  
[72]			You disobeyed an order, Steed. 			Mrs. Peel is dangerous; she cannot 			be trusted.  	Emma looks out the window behind her; eyes widen ... back to --  
[73]			I shall summon security.  	She turns, almost walks into the door as she slips away.  	Emma returns as the ALARM is raised --  
[74] 	Mother, Brenda, et al choke on purple smoke in the bus ...   
[75] 	Thru the blizzard, zooming down streets, landmark buildings looming up topped in 	snow, feet up ... shinnying up the chain wire ...  	"THE MERRY WIDOW WALTZ," no longer heard as old record or ensemble 	arrangement but enormous, for FULL ORCHESTRA ...   
[76] 	which unloads a rope ladder as Emma puts on every ounce of steam ... 	The Man reaches for the dangling ladder -- 	but --   
[77]			Where's Mrs. Peel?  	He signals frantically for Father to trace the call, but being blind, Father just sits there.  
[78]			You're getting yourself into terrible 			trouble, my son. Weather's turning 			very nasty -- and so am I.  
[79]				(grabs mirror; 				searches his face 			Where?  
[80]			I'm warning you for the last time, 			Steed: whoever's behind all this, 			looks like Mrs. Peel, walks like 			Mrs. Peel and kills like Mrs. Peel.  	CLICK.  The line goes dead.   
[81] 	Furious.  
[82]			Steed?? 				 			Find Mrs. Peel.  	Brenda smiles at the thought.  Father rises, grim.   
[83]				 			Emma in Wonderland. Welcome, 			Mrs. Peel. 				 			We've been expecting you. We hope 			you'll enjoy your stay with us. 			Decontamination is almost complete.  
[84]			And you've a new wardrobe. He 			does want you to look attractive. 				 			He tells me you're very beautiful.  	Emma pounds the glass in frustration.  
[85]			Relax, Mrs. Peel. We're hundreds 			of feet below ground. The Ministry 			made it impregnable. No one can 			save you.   
[86]			Steed  
[87]			You reek of Mrs. Peel's Black 			Leather ...  
[88]			Mother betrayed me. She was 			going to replace me with a younger 			Father.  Errand boy that's all I was. 			'Find Steed...'  
[89]			Dr. Darling, this is Father. We 			have an intruder. I repeat --  	Valentine switches off the PA.  
[90] 	The grille pops off and Steed emerges where the guards are waiting for him --  
[91] 	run towards him, Steed swivels gracefully and - slams the bowler in their faces, a 	sartorial knuckleduster -- wham -- !  One drops -- Bam -- !  The other collapses, slump 	to the ground.  Steed stoops down, picks up his hat, sees --  	A dent in its steel top.  For the first time, Steed loses his cool.  Genuine rage.  
[92]			Congratulations. The clouds are 			on course ...  
[93]			Not yet! They haven't heard our 			terms ... !  	Father tries to hit the switch.  Valentine yanks her off.  
[94]			But all those people -- !  	Valentine strikes her hard --  
[95] 	Mother at the controls.  RINGS the ALARM.  Panic stations as -- SIRENS BLARE. 	WARNINGS RING OUT OVER TV and RADIO --  
[96]			Dense cloud formation moving south- 			west. On course for the center of the 			city. A fog floating in from the river. 			The prediction is ... unstable chemical 			reaction. Enforce the curfew ... 			Emergency stand by ... !   
[97]			About your next assignment, Mrs. 			Peel ...  
[98]			Ahem. As I was saying, perhaps 			another macaroon ...  
[99] </html>

dialogues.Thor: [1]					No Admittance  	At a control barrier Steed inserts a card.  Emma sees a light flash up: "Security -- Top 	Priority Clearance Only."  The barrier lifts.  She looks again at Steed, reappraising him 	as Big Ben approaches four.  The car disappears in darkness ...
